data.title: Godot segfaults silently if Opengl 2.1 support is missing
data.body:
```
(gdb) backtrace 
#0  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
#1  0x0000000000514154 in RasterizerGLES2::init (this=0x7ffff2878040) at drivers/gles2/rasterizer_gles2.cpp:7666
#2  0x0000000000f82e23 in VisualServerRaster::init (this=0x7ffff2856040) at servers/visual/visual_server_raster.cpp:5624
#3  0x0000000000f30a30 in VisualServerWrapMT::init (this=0x7ffff2815040) at servers/visual/visual_server_wrap_mt.cpp:152
#4  0x00000000004080a7 in OS_X11::initialize (this=0x7fffffffdeb0, p_desired=..., p_video_driver=0, p_audio_driver=0) at platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:306
#5  0x0000000000410b1b in Main::setup2 () at main/main.cpp:706
#6  0x000000000040ff64 in Main::setup (execpath=0x7fffffffe668 "/data/Proggen/git/config/scripts/godot", argc=1, argv=0x7fffffffe370, p_second_phase=true)
    at main/main.cpp:661
#7  0x00000000004064c8 in main (argc=2, argv=0x7fffffffe368) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:36
```

Running on an old intel graphics chip, should print a little error message along the lines of "need opengl2.1 support to run" before segfaulting.

data.title: tearing on font bitmap in iOS device
data.body:
I imported the dejavu mono font, and it works well testing the scene on the pc

on the ios device however the character image is teared with black dots appearing over the glyphs:
http://i60.tinypic.com/205a62h.jpg

data.title: updating sprite texture corrupts exported pack on OSx
data.body:
Hi I encountered this minor issue while working on a sprite:

I created a sprite and I assigned an image
I opened the image and changed some pixel here and there
The image wasn't updated on the 2d view (no biggie)
Ran the program, the image shown in the sprite was the most recent
Exported the data.pck, the image was not in the pack 
(error in the log about missing res://image.\* )

data.title: Editor hangs while editing GDScript resource
data.body:
I was writing a GDScript inside of the editor. The crash seems to occur mainly while writing a string.
The terminal  keeps printing the following error:

ERROR: get_token_constant: Condition ' tk_rb[ofs].type!=TK_CONSTANT ' is true. returned: tk_rb[0].constant
   At: modules/gdscript/gd_tokenizer.cpp:913.

I'm using elementaryOS (based on Ubuntu 12.04) . 
GoDot Engine v1.0.3917-beta1.
Here is a Screenshot of the Editor after the error occured.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4ZeabT2tWIdc3M0OWxPZUhBcTg/edit?usp=sharing

data.title: Auto select custom property value field when pop up
data.body:
So user can start typing to change value right after custom property pop up; 
And when "tab" key pressed, next focused field will be auto selected too.

data.title: Fix LineEdit select method binding
data.body: "select" method LineEdit was binding to "is_secret" by mistake.

data.title: Export linear/angular velocity sleep threshold to project settings
data.body:
- Export linear/angular velocity sleep threshold value in project settings (under physics category)
- Change default linear velocity sleep threshold to 0.1 ( ref: PhysX default : 0.15, Bullet default: 0.8 ) 
- Fixed typo "treshold" -> "threshold"
- Fixed license text CR/LF inconsistency

data.title: Change target_fps to physics category in project settings
data.body: The "target_fps" from project settings was placed under "display" category wrongly. This commit change it to "physics" category.

data.title: changing Next (auto-queue) doesn't mark scene as changed
data.body:
if you open up a scene (for a character or somesuch) and select the AnimationPlayer node, then click on the =><= blending button, and enter a value for the Next (Auto Queue) field, the Scene does not get marked as changed.

If this is the only change you make before switching to another scene, then you will lose the change without being prompted about it, like you should be.

---

( I poked around in the source code and I got it to mark the scene as changed by inserting an undo step, however, it does not behave as desired.. the text box loses focus after every keystroke and a new undo step is saved for every keystroke, etc.  (And further to that, the undo didn't even work.) I'm currently too much of a newbie to properly fix this, but I did try... I think if I could change the text field to a dropdown menu which lists all the other animations in the AnimationPlayer, that would solve it. )

data.title: begins_with string version fix
GD Shader Language -> material as new Datatype
data.body:
Hi all,
after testing the shader language quite a bit I have an idea for a feature that can be usefull.
Would it be possible to add Material as a separate Datatype that can be imported?

Usage would be something like this:
### uniform material new_mat;

This variable will then be exposed to the ui where a new material can be set. Now I can access a complete material not only textures or something like this. This way one can create a new material that consists of more materials and can be mixed! From the material datatype the diffuse and other attributes need to be accessible of course.

data.title: External editor's path bound to res://
data.body: In Settings->Editor Settings > External Editor - Exec Path impossible to choose path outside res:// directory.

data.title: move away from deprecated Options class and update .gitignore
Can't edit the Vector2Array points of a ConvexPolygonShape2D
data.body:
When adding a shape to an element of a tileset you can't edit the Vector2Array points of the ConvexPolygonShape2D.

You can see the editing box comes up very small usually or sometimes in full but it has no text boxes or anything to edit the points with.

To work around this you have to save the shape to an xml file and manually edit it.

data.title: Apply Force for 3D Objects
data.body:
Hey there..
It would be great if a method for applying force to 3D objects would be added.
First parameter is the Vector itself, and second is if the force will be applied gobal or local to the object. Something like this:

self.apply_force(Vector3 force, bool local)

data.title: Typo in 'Atlas Texture' import menu entry
can't fullscreen on Linux?
data.body:
If I check off the fullscreen option in Project Settings, then run the game, it doesn't actually run in fullscreen mode. Tested with the platformer demo, as well as my own project.

I tried checking the list of fullscreen video modes, and it returns an empty array:

```
    var fsml = OS.get_fullscreen_mode_list()
    print(fsml.size()) # returns 0
```

Possibly related to this, OS.set_video_mode() doesn't seem to do anything - doesn't resize the window and doesn't allow me to toggle fullscreen.

data.title: fly-Dev branch
Get godot to build on FreeBSD
data.body:
There were a few linuxisms that were preventing godot from compiling on FreeBSD.  These changes allow it to build.  I've tested building on Linux and FreeBSD and bin/godot does start up and seem usable.

The joystick code is not working as I'm not familiar with the FreeBSD joystick API.  I ifdefed out the body of the functions. I realize this is probably frowned upon (I don't do much C/C++ stuff) so I'd appreciate a suggestion for a cleaner way to do that.  SDL looks like it might be a good model for cross-platform joystick support.

data.title: Add F key to center 3d viewport to selected node
data.body: Godot has already support center viewport to selected node in 3d view port, but there's no hot-key This commit add F key binding to the view port menu ( View->Selection )

data.title: Instance button of SceneDock now working
data.body: Fixed bug of Instance button of scene dock (file system) tab. It's now working properly.

data.title: Valid XML Tileset: XML is invalid (missing header tags)!
data.body:
Hello!

I develop my own tool to create tileset file used by Godot in his
TileMap nodes so I have not to write such file by hand. The thing is
that Godot Engine complains about the resulting file:

![VuKmlJw.png](http://i.imgur.com/VuKmlJw.png)

and then:

![BPnogJk.png](http://i.imgur.com/BPnogJk.png)

even though the result file was correctly written with a specialized
library (python's lxml), [here output file](http://pastebin.com/YpNpMBYY)

Here is [my tool](https://bitbucket.org/shackra/holy-auto-tileset/src), [the interesting part starts here](https://bitbucket.org/shackra/holy-auto-tileset/src/8600be656e90427def82631919048b9b2bbd8b5a/src/ui.py?at=default#cl-109).

I call it _Holy auto tileset_ and I'll be releasing executables versions
of it for Windows and GNU/Linux as soon this issue can be fixed ;)

![syIcLSp.png](http://i.imgur.com/syIcLSp.png)

I also noticed that Godot use its own XML parser, even though [pugixml](http://pugixml.org/) exists under the MIT license. If there is no objection from the devs, I could try to implement pugixml under the existing xml parser code!

cheers!

data.title: How does one change the font size for the editor, in the godot source?
data.body: Been looking at font class in scene and having trouble figuring out how and where the kerning details are all calculated. The default theme in use shows a font being loaded for the editor, I am looking for a list of all classes involved in this process.

data.title: More fixes to the build system
data.body: 1 more patches for fixing the build system on Windows for Visual Studio and one more for improved handling of LINKFLAGS and CFLAGS

data.title: Removed OF
data.body: OF is fine for the eighties but not useful for today.

data.title: Can't run windows 32 or 64 bit build.
data.body:
Started with godot_win64 because I am Win 7 64 bit running on AMD.
Tried the godot_win32 because what the hell.

Same thing.
Console prints a couple things then i see.

<exe file> has stopped working.
Windows is checking for a solution to the problem.

data.title: Problem with Android touch input
data.body:
There seems to be a problem with the touch input on Android. A touches position is only being updated after dragging over the screen. Also the first position is at the last position the finger has been lifted, or (0,0) if it is the first touch respectively.

Here the code I tested it with, it works as intended with a mouse on Windows 8 64bit:
http://pastebin.com/Ax8diysC

data.title: Suggestion: add zoom in/out support to the build-in code editor
data.body:
Reading code from distance (in my case, big monitor at ~ one meter) is really difficult, so adding simple zoom support by typical ctrl+mousewheel would be awesome.
For now I copy/paste to/from another text editor.

data.title: Stop tracking platform/server/logo.h for it will be autogenerated
fix issue #119 Win32 tools=no build mangles system library names
data.body: Look over and test on other windows machines. This works on my windows 8.1 with visual studio 2013.
